summary: Completed comprehensive testing of One Island Pulse Jamaica community map application. Backend APIs are fully functional (11/12 tests passed). Frontend loads correctly with beautiful Jamaica map, but has critical modal overlay issues preventing marker creation flow.

minor_bugs.issue: Returns 403 instead of 401 for unauthorized access
minor_bugs.impact: Minor - both codes indicate proper authentication protection

critical_bugs.issue: Modal overlay blocks interactions and doesn't close properly after successful login
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents marker creation flow - users cannot add markers even when logged in

critical_bugs.issue: Add marker modal doesn't open when clicking on map
critical_bugs.impact: Core functionality broken - users cannot add markers to map

ui_bugs.issue: Auth state inconsistency - user appears logged in but gets 'Please login to add markers' error

passed_tests: Backend marker CRUD operations (POST, PUT, DELETE /api/markers)
Backend marker retrieval with category filtering (GET /api/markers)
Frontend homepage loads with Jamaica map centered correctly
Frontend category filter buttons work (All, Events, Obstacles, Objects, Alerts)
Frontend map view and feed view toggle works
Frontend feed view displays empty state correctly
Frontend map instructions appear at bottom

success_percentage.frontend: 65% (critical marker creation flow blocked by modal issues)

action_item_for_main_agent: Fix critical modal overlay issue in AuthModal component that prevents proper form interactions and modal closing. The dialog overlay is intercepting pointer events, blocking the submit button clicks and preventing the modal from closing after successful login. This breaks the entire marker creation flow. Also investigate authentication state inconsistency where users appear logged in but still get login prompts.
